Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.2: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.3: INTERPRETATION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for an instance where the offsetdistances to the top and base of a strat unit are measured.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: BASE OFFSET TRUE VERTICAL DISTANCE: The True vertical distance to the baseof the stratigraphic unit. A negative value indicates that the base of the stratigraphicunit is above the point in the well path. A 0 value indicates that the base of thestratigraphic unit coincides with the well bore (either crossing into or out of it). Postivevalues indicate that the base of the stratigraphic unit is below the point in the wellpath.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: INTERPRETER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thebusiness associate who created this interpretation of the distance relationship tostratigraphic units.
Column Comment.10: LOCATION TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of object being given a legallocation. For example, node, well, ...
Column Comment.11: NODE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to a specific point (node)on the wellbore.
Column Comment.12: NODE POSITION: The position on a wellbore path. For example: surface point,bottomhole point, kick-off point, ....
Column Comment.13: PICK DATE: The date that this data was picked and interpreted.
Column Comment.14: PICK DEPTH: The measured depth along the well path that the interpreted top andbase TVD relate to.
Column Comment.16: PICK LOCATION: identifies the location or type of formation (strat unit) pick. Forexample top, base or middle.
Column Comment.17: WELL NODE STRAT UNIT PICK METHOD: The method used to pick the distancefrom a well node to the top and base of a stratigraphic unit. Could be logs, cores,other kinds of studies etc.
Column Comment.18: PICK METHOD DESCRIPTION: A short narrative description of the method used topick distances from a well node to the top and base (vertically) of a stratigraphic unit.Use in conjuction with the reference table to provide additional information when it isuseful to do so.
Column Comment.19: PICK QUALITY: the quality of the interpretation of the distances between the wellpath and the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.20: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.21: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this interpretation should beused for mapping and other purposes.
Column Comment.22: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.23: SOURCE: The individual, company, agency, application or other source designatedas the source of information for this row.
Column Comment.24: TOP OFFSET TRUE VERTICAL DISTANCE: The True vertical distance to the top ofthe stratigraphic unit. A negative value indicates that the top of the stratigraphic unitis above the point in the well path. A 0 value indicates that the top ofthe stratigraphicunit coincides with the well bore (either crossing into or out of it). Postive valuesindicate that the top of the stratigraphic unit is below the point in the well path.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
